Error: Source is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file
Solution: the path to activate virtual environment "source env/bin/activate" is for Unix/linux and git bash, for Windows the path is "env\scripts\activate"
Double quotes should be used instead of single quotes
Python interpreter in vs code should be set on (venv)

Error: Vs Code Python not finding venv environment
Solution: Open the directory that contains your 'env' directory, not 'env' itself

URIs (Uniform Resource Identifier ) can't contain non-ASCII characters(Farsi,for instance) and IRI (Internationalized Resource Identifier) should be converted to a plain ASCII URI by using the "urllib.parse.quote" function.
